summary: This is an email exchange from June 18, 2020, discussing coordination to help four victims who were minors when abused by Jeffrey Epstein obtain services. The correspondence indicates ongoing communication attempts ('phone tag') between the parties involved.

events.title: Email coordination for victim services
events.description: Email exchange discussing the need to help four victims who were minors when abused by Jeffrey Epstein obtain services, indicating ongoing communication attempts.

keyFacts: The document is an email exchange dated June 18, 2020.
It references four victims who were minors at the time they were abused by Jeffrey Epstein.
The purpose of the correspondence is to coordinate obtaining services for these victims.
The parties have been having difficulty connecting, described as 'playing phone tag'.
The email suggests the victims' cases were still being actively managed years after Epstein's crimes.
